qas.question: What was the first available antibiotic?
Who led the team that came up with Prontosil?
What prize did Domagk get for his work?
What was the first available cocci?
Who led the team that came up with Bayer Laboratories?
What prize did Prontosil get for its work?
What opened the era of Germany?

context: The first sulfonamide and first commercially available antibacterial, <a0_0><b4_0>Prontosil<b4_0/><a0_0/>, was developed by a research team led by <a2_0><b6_0>Gerhard Domagk<b6_0/><a2_0/> in 1932 at the Bayer Laboratories of the <a1_0><b5_0>IG Farben<b5_0/><a1_0/> conglomerate in Germany. Domagk received the <a3_0><b7_0>1939 Nobel Prize for Medicine<b7_0/><a3_0/> for his efforts. Prontosil had a relatively broad effect against Gram-positive cocci, but not against enterobacteria. Research was stimulated apace by its success. The discovery and <b8_0>development of this sulfonamide drug<b8_0/> opened the era of antibacterials.
